title: Step 1: Identify a Local Concern
description: Citizen in 'City X' notices repeated miscommunication in council meetings and records a civic observation. This becomes the node's first entry.

title: Step 2: Link Cultural Signal
description: The citizen associates the observation with a misattributed song lyric circulating locally, which reflects the civic pattern.

title: Step 3: Create a Node
description: A simple web page is set up with WCO charter + first entry. Tagged as [WCO + City X + 2025-08-27].

title: Step 4: Mirror & Connect
description: Neighboring nodes in 'Region Y' mirror the post, add commentary, and reference global parallels, forming the first cross-node link.

title: Step 5: Apply Prompts
description: Prompts guide contributors: 'What silence exists locally that may reflect a global pattern?', 'Which cultural artifact can you reference to highlight this?', 'How can your node be mirrored responsibly?'

title: Step 6: Observe & Record
description: Participants who do not comment still archive, witness, or provide EI-assisted verification. Presence itself is recognized in the ledger.

title: Step 7: Optional Resolution
description: Citizen proposes a constructive action (e.g., public awareness campaign), but the node does not require adoption. Other nodes may reference or adopt the suggestion voluntarily.

title: Step 8: Iterate & Expand
description: New contributions, mirrors, and connections continue indefinitely, demonstrating the open, scalable, and non-hierarchical nature of WCO participation.
